ProgramName: Accountancy MSA
Description: The University of North Alabama’s Master of Accountancy (MAcc) program is a 30-credit hour graduate business program that will prepare students for a career in accounting. Graduates with an MAcc degree possess the technical skills and broad business perspective needed for a successful career. Students who graduate with their MAcc degree from UNA meet the educational requirements to sit for the CPA exam in the state of Alabama. The UNA MAcc program has consistently ranked as one of the top programs by various publications. The accounting program at UNA is known throughout the region for its quality and for the success of its graduates. Our program faculty are highly qualified, with a majority holding a doctorate degree and a CPA certification. They offer a diverse range of expertise and experience and are passionate about students’ professional development.
Accredidation: The Master of Accountancy program has separate accounting accreditation through AACSB International—The Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business. UNA is one of only 194 universities in the world to hold this prestigious accreditation. AACSB represents the highest standard of achievement for business schools worldwide.

ProgramName: Adult-Gerontology Acute Care Nurse Practitioner Cert
Description: The Anderson College of Nursing and Health Professions offers post-graduate APRN certificate programs for nurses who have an earned Master of Science in Nursing (MSN) or Doctor of Nursing Practice (DNP) degree and wish to obtain an additional specialty certification as a Nurse Practitioner. The certificates are designed to be completed in four to five semesters of part-time study. Post-Graduate APRN Certificate students are accepted for fall and spring admission.
Accredidation: The baccalaureate degree program in nursing, master's degree program in nursing, and post-graduate APRN certificate program at the University of North Alabama are accredited by the Commission on Collegiate Nursing Education (http://www.ccneaccreditation.org).

ProgramName: Adult-Gerontology Acute Care Nurse Practitioner MSN
EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English must demonstrate English proficiency through the submission of a satisfactory score on the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL), International English Language Testing System (IELTS), Pearson Test of English (PTE) Academic, or Duolingo. The following are the minimum score requirements for admission to a degree program: TOEFL- 79 iBT (internet-based test) or 550 PBT (paper-based test), IELTS- an overall band score of 6.0, PTE Academic- a score of 54, or Duolingo - a score of 105. Students may also meet the English proficiency requirement by completion of the University of North Alabama's intensive English Program (ELS) with a certificate of completion for level 112.
Requirements: Unconditional admission to the MSN program may be granted to applicants who meet the following criteria: Hold a Bachelor of Science in Nursing degree from a nationally accredited program (ACEN or CCNE). Have a minimum overall undergraduate GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale or a 3.0 on the last 60 hours of undergraduate coursework. Hold an unencumbered registered nurse license in the state where clinical experiences will be completed. Have completed an undergraduate or graduate statistics course with a grade of C or better. Submit a completed application to the Office of Graduate Admissions. Provide evidence of a minimum of one year of recent clinical experience as a Registered Nurse in an acute care setting. This will be verified by the employing agency. Submission of three recommendation forms (from a current or former supervisor, a peer, and a former faculty member if possible). Submit a resume. Submit a professional goal statement. Applicants may be required to participate in an interview.
Department: Anderson College of Nursing and Health Professions
Description: The Adult-Gerontology Acute Care Nurse Practitioner (AGACNP) track is designed to prepare students for advanced practice nursing with acutely ill adult and gerontology patients. Graduates are educated to provide a spectrum of care from disease prevention to acute and critical care management. The AGACNP is prepared to care for patients in intensive care units, emergency departments, specialty labs (e.g., cardiac catheterization, electrophysiology), specialty clinics (e.g., cardiology, pulmonology) and hospitalist/intensivist services. The AGACNP is a member of the multi-disciplinary healthcare team and practices in collaboration with physicians and other healthcare providers. Graduates are eligible to take the American Nurses Credentialing Center (ANCC) or the American Association of Critical Care Nurses (AACN) Adult-Gerontology Acute Care Nurse Practitioner certification examinations.
Accredidation: The baccalaureate degree program in nursing, master's degree program in nursing, and post-graduate APRN certificate program at the University of North Alabama are accredited by the Commission on Collegiate Nursing Education (http://www.ccneaccreditation.org).

ProgramName: Adult-Gerontology Primary Care Nurse Practitioner Cert
EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English must submit one of the following to meet the English proficiency requirement: TOEFL - Minimum score of 79 (IBT) or 550 (PBT), IELTS - Minimum score of 6.0, PTE - Minimum score of 54, Duolingo - Minimum score of 110, or ELS - Completion of ELS Level 112.
Requirements: Unconditional admission to the graduate program at UNA. A Master of Science in Nursing from a regionally accredited institution and a nationally accredited nursing program (ACEN or CCNE). A current, unencumbered registered nurse license in the state where clinical experiences will be completed. A minimum of one year of direct patient care experience as a registered nurse. A minimum cumulative GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale on all previous academic work. Successful completion of a 3-credit hour undergraduate or graduate-level statistics course with a grade of C or better. Submission of the following documents to the Office of Graduate Admissions: Official transcripts from all postsecondary institutions attended, Three letters of professional reference attesting to the applicant’s potential for graduate study, A curriculum vitae or resume, A personal statement/essay, Copy of RN license. Submission of a completed background check. Submission of a completed drug screen.
Department: Anderson College of Nursing and Health Professions
Description: The Adult-Gerontology Primary Care Nurse Practitioner Certificate (AGPCNP) track at UNA prepares graduates to provide primary health care for adults across the lifespan from adolescence through senescence. The curriculum emphasizes health promotion and maintenance, and the diagnosis and management of common acute and chronic health problems. Upon completion of the program, graduates will be eligible to seek certification as an Adult-Gerontology Primary Care Nurse Practitioner through the American Nurses Credentialing Center (ANCC) or the American Academy of Nurse Practitioners (AANP).
Accredidation: The baccalaureate degree program in nursing, master's degree program in nursing, and post-graduate APRN certificate programs at the University of North Alabama are accredited by the Commission on Collegiate Nursing Education (http://www.ccneaccreditation.org).

ProgramName: Adult-Gerontology Primary Care Nurse Practitioner MSN
EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English must provide evidence of proficiency in the English language. This can be met by submitting one of the following official test scores: TOEFL (Test of English as a Foreign Language), IELTS (International English Language Testing System), PTE (Pearson Test of English Academic), Duolingo, or by successful completion of ELS Language Center's Level 112.
Requirements: Application to the MSN program is a two-part process. Applicants must first apply to the UNA Office of Graduate Admissions. Following application to the University, applicants must complete the Anderson College of Nursing and Health Professions MSN Program Application. Requirements for the Anderson College of Nursing and Health Professions MSN Program application include: a current resume or curriculum vitae; a statement of purpose (500-750 words) describing professional goals and motivation for graduate study; three (3) letters of recommendation; official transcripts from all post-secondary institutions attended; a current, unencumbered registered nurse license in the state where clinical experiences will occur; a Baccalaureate degree in nursing (BSN) from a regionally accredited institution with ACEN or CCNE program accreditation; an undergraduate GPA of 3.0 or greater on a 4.0 scale; a statistics course with a grade of C or better; and evidence of one year full-time nursing experience as a registered nurse prior to the first clinical course.
Department: Anderson College of Nursing and Health Professions
Description: The adult-gerontology primary care nurse practitioner track is a hybrid program designed to prepare nurses to provide primary care services to the entire spectrum of adults, including young adults, adults, and older adults. The primary focus of the adult-gerontology primary care nurse practitioner is to provide comprehensive, chronic, and continuous care to patients in a variety of primary care settings. Adult-gerontology primary care nurse practitioners are educated to provide a broad range of primary care services that includes performing health assessments, ordering, performing, and interpreting diagnostic tests, and prescribing medications and other treatments. Upon successful completion of the program of study, graduates will be eligible to take the American Nurses Credentialing Center (ANCC) Adult-Gerontology Primary Care Nurse Practitioner certification examination or the American Academy of Nurse Practitioners (AANP) Adult-Gerontology Primary Care Nurse Practitioner certification examination. Upon successful completion of the certification exam, graduates will be eligible for licensure in their state of residence. Graduates who apply for initial licensure in a compact state, or who change their primary state of residence to a compact state, may be eligible for a multistate license. Additionally, graduates who live in and practice in compact states may be eligible for a multistate license.
Accredidation: The baccalaureate degree program in nursing, master's degree program in nursing, and post-graduate APRN certificate program at the University of North Alabama are accredited by the Commission on Collegiate Nursing Education (http://www.ccneaccreditation.org).

ProgramName: Advertising MA
EnglishScore: Applicants must meet one of the following requirements: TOEFL score of 79 (IBT), 550 (PBT), or 213 (CBT); IELTS score of 6.0; PTE score of 54; Duolingo score of 110; or completion of ELS level 112 with a 2.5 GPA.
Requirements: Admission to the program is based on the student’s undergraduate record and other indicators of aptitude for graduate study. Applicants must have a bachelor’s degree from an accredited institution. Applicants must submit a completed application for admission to graduate study. Applicants must have official transcripts from each institution attended sent directly to the Office of Graduate Admissions. Applicants must have an overall undergraduate grade point average of at least 2.75 on a 4.00 scale. Applicants with an overall undergraduate grade point average of 2.50 to 2.74 on a 4.00 scale will be considered for conditional admission. A formal application to the M.A. in Professional Communication program, statement of purpose, and three letters of recommendation must be submitted to the Department of Communication Graduate Coordinator.

ProgramName: Anthropology MA
Anthropology MA: Applied Biological Anthropology
EnglishScore: Applicants from countries where English is not the native language must submit proof of English language proficiency. Accepted options include: a minimum score of 79 on the TOEFL iBT (or 550 on the PBT), a minimum score of 6.0 on the IELTS, a minimum score of 54 on the PTE, a minimum score of 100 on the Duolingo English Test, or completion of Level 112 of the ELS Language Center.
Requirements: A bachelor's degree from a regionally accredited institution with at least a 3.0 GPA in the last 60 semester hours of undergraduate work. At least 18 hours of previous undergraduate anthropology coursework with a grade of C or better. A formal application to the Graduate School. Official transcripts from each institution attended. A statement of purpose of at least 500 words describing the applicant’s research interests, professional goals, and reasons for pursuing a master’s degree in anthropology at UNA. Three letters of recommendation submitted via the online application system from individuals qualified to judge the applicant's potential for success in a graduate program. At least two letters should be from former professors. A writing sample demonstrating the applicant's ability to conduct research and write a scholarly paper. This should be a research paper written for a previous course. There is no minimum or maximum word count.
Department: College of Arts, Sciences, and Engineering
Description: The Master of Arts in Anthropology with a concentration in Applied Biological Anthropology at the University of North Alabama (UNA) offers a unique and comprehensive educational experience for students interested in the practical application of biological anthropology. This program is designed to provide students with a strong theoretical foundation in biological anthropology, combined with hands-on training in research methods and techniques that can be applied to real-world problems. The curriculum focuses on areas such as human osteology, forensic anthropology, bioarchaeology, primatology, and human biology, preparing students for careers in academia, government agencies, museums, and the private sector.
ScholarshipType: Academic scholarships, Graduate Assistantships, Fellowships, International Student Scholarships

ProgramName: Applied Carbonate Geology Cert
Requirements: Admission into the program will be based on approval from the geology certificate committee. For non-degree seeking students, the University of North Alabama’s requirements for undergraduate and graduate admissions must be met. Current UNA students who wish to earn the certificate should contact Dr. M. Taylor to fill out an application form for program admission. Contact information is on the right side of this page. Students working on the Certificate in Applied Carbonate Geology are expected to maintain a minimum GPA of 3.0 in courses in the certificate program.
Description: The Certificate in Applied Carbonate Geology focuses on the depositional and diagenetic aspects of carbonate rocks and the unique challenges these present to geologists. The certificate provides students with an understanding of modern carbonate depositional environments, petrographic techniques for carbonate rock characterization and diagenesis, and experience in subsurface geologic methods. Carbonate rocks are important hosts of oil and natural gas, groundwater, and Mississippi-Valley type ore deposits. In addition, the unique properties of carbonate rocks have important implications for CO2 sequestration and other environmental geology applications. This certificate is designed to be completed in one year and requires 12 graduate credit hours.

ProgramName: Applied Learning Sciences EdD
EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English must provide proof of English proficiency by one of the following: TOEFL iBT score of 79, IELTS score of 6.0, PTE score of 54, Duolingo English Test score of 105, or successful completion of ELS Level 112.
Requirements: Hold a masters or educational specialist degree from an accredited institution. A cumulative GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale on all graduate coursework. Submit an application to the Office of Graduate Admissions. Submit a professional resume or curriculum vitae. Submit official transcripts from all institutions attended. Submit three recommendations from school administrators or supervisors using the Leadership Disposition form. Submit a writing sample that responds to a provided prompt. Instructions on how to complete the writing sample will be sent after the application is submitted. Complete an admissions interview.
Description: The Executive Doctorate of Business Administration (EDBA) at the University of North Alabama is a professional doctoral program for executives and senior managers who want to advance their knowledge, skills, and abilities to the highest level. The EDBA is designed for working professionals who desire to distinguish themselves as thought leaders in their respective fields. The EDBA curriculum is designed to produce scholar-practitioners who can develop and lead evidence-based management and data-driven decision making. EDBA graduates will be equipped to advance their careers to C-suite and other upper-level management positions in both the for-profit and non-profit sectors. In addition, EDBA graduates will be qualified to teach in business programs at most universities.
Accredidation: The University of North Alabama Sanders College of Business and Technology is accredited by AACSB International - The Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business.

ProgramName: Applied Learning Sciences EdD Online
Requirements: Applicants for admission to the Applied Learning Sciences, Ed.D. program should submit the following to the Office of Graduate Admissions: Completed UNA Graduate Application; Official transcripts from all colleges/universities attended, including an official transcript that shows a master's degree was conferred from a regionally accredited institution; Three letters of recommendation; A current résumé; A writing sample: An academic paper or professional report which demonstrates the applicant’s potential for success in a doctoral program; A statement of purpose that includes a description of the applicant’s professional goals, research interests, and a rationale for why the applicant is a strong candidate for the Applied Learning Sciences, Ed.D. program; and A minimum GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale on all graduate-level coursework. A screening interview may be required.
Department: College of Education and Human Sciences
Concentration: Instructional Design and Technology, Literacy, Teacher Leader
Description: The online Doctor of Education in Applied Learning Sciences from the University of North Alabama has been designed for educators and other professionals who want to understand learning and teaching from an evidence-based perspective. This doctoral program is designed to provide you with a broad understanding of learning sciences while developing your expertise through one of our three concentrations. Our Applied Learning Sciences doctoral degree will equip you with a nuanced view of education that includes the historical context for today’s educational landscape, the sociological and cultural factors that affect learning, the psychological perspectives that inform educational research, and the policies that shape educational practices.
Accredidation: The University of North Alabama is accredited by the Southern Association of Colleges and Schools Commission on Colleges (SACSCOC) to award bachelor's, master's, education specialist, and doctoral degrees. The College of Education and Human Sciences is also accredited by the Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP).

ProgramName: Applied Physiology MSEd
EnglishScore: Students from non-English speaking countries must provide proof of English proficiency. This can be met by providing an official score report from one of the following: a minimum score of 525 on the paper-based (PBT) or 70 on the Internet-based (iBT) TOEFL, a minimum score of 6.0 on the IELTS, a minimum score of 54 on the PTE (Pearson Test of English) Academic, a minimum score of 100 on the Duolingo test, or successful completion of Level 112 of the ELS Language Centers Intensive Program.
Requirements:
Admission to the Applied Physiology Program is based upon the student’s academic background, professional experience, recommendations, and personal statement. In order to be considered for admission, applicants must satisfy the general requirements for admission to graduate study and the Department of Kinesiology.

1. Complete an application to the Graduate Studies Office.
2. Submit three letters of recommendation to the Department of Kinesiology.
3. Provide a written essay that outlines reasons for wanting to obtain a graduate degree in Applied Physiology.
4. Minimum cumulative grade point average (GPA) of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale on all undergraduate coursework.
5. A cumulative grade point average (GPA) of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale on all graduate coursework from a regionally accredited university.
6. Students with a GPA of less than 3.0 must score at the 40th percentile or above on the GRE General Test (verbal and quantitative) to be considered for admission.
7. All students must submit GRE General Test Scores.
Department: College of Education and Human Sciences
Description: The Master of Science in Education with a concentration in Applied Physiology is designed for students seeking advanced knowledge and skills in exercise physiology. The curriculum integrates physiological and anatomical principles with the study of human movement. Through coursework, laboratory experiences, and research, students gain a comprehensive understanding of how the body responds and adapts to exercise. This program prepares graduates for careers in clinical settings, corporate wellness, strength and conditioning, research, and for further doctoral studies. Students will have the opportunity to work closely with faculty on research projects and gain hands-on experience in our state-of-the-art laboratories.

ProgramName: Applied Remote Sensing MPS
EnglishScore: Proficiency in English must be demonstrated by one of the following: Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) with a minimum score of 540 (paper-based), or 207 (computer-based), or 76 (Internet-based); International English Language Testing System (IELTS) with a minimum score of 6.0; Pearson Test of English (PTE) with a minimum score of 54; ELS Language Centers Level 112 with a grade of B (2.5) or higher; Duolingo English Test with a minimum score of 100. An applicant is exempt from the English proficiency requirement if they have earned a baccalaureate degree from a regionally accredited U.S. institution of higher education or the equivalent from a country on the English Proficiency Waiver list.
Department: College of Arts, Sciences, and Engineering
Description: The MPS in Applied GIS concentration provides students with a solid foundation in geospatial technologies including Geographic Information Systems (GIS), Remote Sensing, Global Positioning Systems (GPS), and related technologies (e.g., mobile mapping, web-based mapping). The purpose of this concentration is to provide specialized training in geospatial technologies that leads to career advancement for students from a broad range of academic and professional backgrounds. The program curriculum is designed to balance theoretical and applied concepts, with a strong focus on project based learning. Students can expect to learn the functional and analytical aspects of GIS and other geospatial technologies, which include the collection, management, analysis, and dissemination of geospatial information. The curriculum emphasizes the application of geospatial technologies to real-world problems. Students in this concentration are expected to demonstrate knowledge and mastery of geospatial technologies by completing a capstone project that is selected by the student with approval from the Department of Geography Graduate Coordinator. The capstone experience allows students the opportunity to integrate their knowledge by applying geospatial technologies to a variety of applications including, but not limited to, environmental management, urban and regional planning, and economic development. The capstone provides a bridge between graduate study and a professional career, and its completion demonstrates a student’s mastery of geospatial concepts, ability to conduct independent research, and make a significant contribution to the geospatial technology field as a whole.

ProgramName: Aquaculture MPS
EnglishScore: In addition to the specific requirements for the program to which an applicant is seeking admission, international students must submit one of the following as evidence of English proficiency: Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) with a minimum score of 500 on the paper-based test (PBT) or 61 on the Internet-based test (iBT); International English Language Testing System (IELTS) with a minimum score of 5.5; Pearson Test of English (PTE) Academic with a minimum score of 46; Duolingo with a minimum score of 95; Successful completion of the English Language Services (ELS) language program, Level 112.
Description: The Aquaculture concentration of the Master of Professional Studies program is designed to provide graduate training in aquaculture for students whose primary career interests are in the professions of government, business, and industry, as opposed to research and teaching. The curriculum is interdisciplinary, but its foundation rests on the biological sciences of fisheries, aquatic ecology, water quality, nutrition, physiology, and genetics. Applied fields in business are also integral parts of the curriculum, providing students with knowledge and skill in accounting, marketing,management, and economics. Coursework and professional experience are integrated to ensure students receive the practical experience necessary to be successful in the aquaculture industry.

ProgramName: Architectural Engineering MSAE
Requirements: A bachelor’s degree from a regionally accredited institution with an undergraduate GPA of 2.75 or higher on a 4.0 scale. Official transcripts from all institutions attended. A resume or curriculum vitae. A statement of purpose. Three letters of recommendation. International students whose native language is not English must submit a satisfactory score on the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL), International English Language Testing System (IELTS), or Duolingo.
Department: College of Arts, Sciences, and Engineering
Concentration: Building Structures, Building Mechanical Systems, or Building Enclosure Systems
Description: Architectural Engineering is the application of engineering principles and technology to building design and construction. The purpose of this program is to provide the knowledge and skills necessary to design building systems. Students can specialize in one of three areas: Building Structures, Building Mechanical Systems, or Building Enclosure Systems. Graduates of this program may go on to careers in consulting engineering firms, construction companies, building equipment manufacturers, facility management companies or government agencies.

ProgramName: Architecture: Classical Architecture Cert
EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English are required to demonstrate English proficiency by submitting one of the following: TOEFL: Minimum score of 79 iBT (internet-based) or 550 PBT (paper-based); IELTS: Minimum score of 6.0; PTE: Minimum score of 54; Duolingo English Test: Minimum score of 105; or successful completion of the University of North Alabama’s English as a Second Language (ESL) Program.
Requirements:
In addition to meeting the university admission requirements for graduate studies, the applicant must:
1. Submit a portfolio of 10-20 images of previous undergraduate or professional work. The portfolio should include samples of hand-drawing, two- and three-dimensional design, and may include architectural drawings, paintings, prints, photographs, and/or sculpture.
2. Submit a 250-word statement of purpose.
3. Submit a resume.
4. Complete a formal interview with program faculty.
Portfolios, resumes, and statements of purpose should be uploaded through the Graduate Admissions application portal.
Description: The University of North Alabama, in partnership with the Institute of Classical Architecture & Art (ICAA), offers a graduate-level Certificate in Classical Architecture. This 15-credit hour certificate program provides students with a working knowledge of classical architectural design. The coursework offers an introduction to the classical orders, the literature of classical architecture, proportion, and the study of precedent, and offers one of two concentrations in either architectural design or architectural history & theory.

ProgramName: Artist Development Cert Online
EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English must submit evidence of English proficiency. This can be met by providing an acceptable score on the TOEFL (minimum 61 iBT or 500 PBT), IELTS (minimum 5.5), PTE Academic (minimum 46), or Duolingo English Test (minimum 90). Successful completion of ELS Language Centers Level 112 is also accepted.
Department: College of Arts, Sciences, and Engineering
Description: The online Certificate in Artist Development is a 12-credit hour undergraduate certificate program for non-degree-seeking students that can be completed in two semesters. It is designed to equip aspiring artists, songwriters, producers, and entrepreneurs with foundational creative and technical skills and essential knowledge for pursuing a career in today’s music business and recording industries.
Accredidation: All programs in the Department of Visual Arts and Design are accredited by the National Association of Schools of Art and Design (NASAD).

Department: College of Education & Human Sciences

ProgramName: Arts Management Cert Online
EnglishScore: All applicants for graduate admission whose native language is not English are required to submit proof of English proficiency by one of the following methods: TOEFL with a minimum score of 550 on the paper-based test (PBT) or 79 on the internet-based test (iBT), IELTS with a minimum score of 6.0, PTE with a minimum score of 54, Duolingo with a minimum score of 100, or successful completion of the ELS Language Centers Level 112.

Submission of official transcripts from all colleges/universities attended. A statement of purpose of at least 300 words outlining the applicant’s interest in the field and career goals. A curriculum vitae/resume.
Department: College of Arts, Sciences, and Engineering
Description: The Arts Management certificate is a 12-hour online program of study which provides graduate-level coursework for individuals seeking employment in the arts management field. The certificate is appropriate for individuals with bachelor's degrees who wish to enhance their professional profile, practicing arts managers who do not have a formal arts management education, and currently-enrolled graduate students who wish to augment their degree. The courses within the Arts Management certificate may be applied to the Master of Arts in Public History degree with a concentration in Public Humanities.
Accredidation: The Department of Art is accredited by the National Association of Schools of Art and Design (NASAD).
ScholarshipType: Graduate Assistantships, Graduate Council Fellowships, Graduate Student Research Grants

ProgramName: Arts Presenting Fundamentals Cert Online
EnglishScore: International applicants must demonstrate English proficiency. UNA accepts a minimum score of 79 on the TOEFL (iBT), 6.0 on the IELTS, 54 on the PTE, or 105 on the Duolingo English Test. Successful completion of the ELS Language Center's Level 112 is also accepted.
Requirements:
To be admitted to the Arts Presenting Fundamentals Certificate program, applicants must meet one of the following requirements:

1. An earned baccalaureate degree from a regionally accredited institution with a cumulative GPA of 2.50 or higher on a 4.0 scale.
2. An earned graduate degree from a regionally accredited institution with a cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher on a 4.0 scale.

Requirements for Clear Admission

1. Completed application for graduate admission.
2. Official baccalaureate degree transcript from a regionally accredited institution.
3. Official transcripts from all colleges/universities attended.
4. One of the following:
    * Cumulative undergraduate GPA of 2.50 or higher on a 4.00 scale.
    * Cumulative graduate GPA of 3.00 or higher on a 4.00 scale for a completed graduate degree.
Department: College of Arts, Sciences, and Engineering
Description: The Graduate Certificate in Arts Presenting Fundamentals is an 18-hour program designed to provide students with comprehensive knowledge and skills in the field of arts presenting. This program is offered online and provides students with the flexibility to balance their education with their professional and personal commitments. The program focuses on the fundamentals of arts presenting, including programming, marketing, fundraising, financial management, and audience development. Students will learn how to develop and implement successful arts programming, create effective marketing campaigns, and build strong relationships with donors and patrons. The curriculum is designed to provide students with a solid foundation in the principles and practices of arts presenting and to prepare them for careers in a variety of arts organizations, including theaters, museums, galleries, and performing arts centers. The program is ideal for individuals who are currently working in the arts and want to advance their careers, as well as those who are new to the field and want to gain the skills and knowledge needed to succeed.

ProgramName: Athletic Training MSAT
EnglishScore: English proficiency for international graduate students can be demonstrated by one of the following: TOEFL iBT 79 (or 550 PBT), IELTS 6.0, PTE 54, Duolingo 105, or ELS Level 112.
Requirements:
Admission to the Master of Science in Athletic Training (MSAT) program is competitive and based on academic achievement and other selective criteria. The Athletic Training Program Admissions Committee evaluates applicants on the basis of their potential for success in the program and the profession. To be eligible for consideration for admission into the MSAT program, applicants must meet the following criteria:

- Bachelor’s degree from a regionally accredited institution
- Minimum cumulative undergraduate GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale
- Completion of prerequisite coursework with a C or better in all courses
- Completion of 50 observation hours with an athletic trainer
- Three letters of recommendation
- A written essay (500-1000 words) to include:
    - Your career goals and aspirations
    - Your motivation for pursuing the MSAT at UNA
    - The qualities that you possess which you believe will make you a successful student and athletic trainer
- A current resume that includes:
    - Education
    - Work experience
    - Honors/awards
    - Professional organization membership
    - Volunteer/community service
- Completed Athletic Training Program Technical Standards Form
Description: The Master of Science in Athletic Training (MSAT) at the University of North Alabama is a 5-semester professional graduate program designed to prepare students for a career as an athletic trainer. The MSAT program provides students with the knowledge and skills necessary to become a competent and compassionate healthcare professional. Students will learn how to prevent, diagnose, and treat injuries and illnesses in a variety of settings, including high schools, colleges, professional sports, and clinical settings. Students who successfully complete the MSAT program are eligible to sit for the Board of Certification (BOC) examination.
Accredidation: The Master of Science in Athletic Training program is accredited by the Commission on Accreditation of Athletic Training Education (CAATE), 6850 Austin Center Blvd., Suite 100, Austin, TX 78731-3101. The program has been placed on Probation as of February 19, 2024 by the CAATE.

ProgramName: Atmospheric Sciences MS
EnglishScore: One of the following is required for admission to a graduate degree program: Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) iBT score of 79. International English Language Testing System (IELTS) score of 6.0. Pearson Test of English (PTE) Academic score of 54. Duolingo English Test with a score of 110.
MinimumGreScore: A combined verbal and quantitative score of 300 on the Graduate Record Examination (GRE) and an analytical writing score of 3.0 or greater.

ProgramName: Atmospheric Sciences MPS
Requirements: An official transcript from an accredited institution with a baccalaureate degree with a minimum 2.75 GPA. A resume/CV. A statement of purpose (a one page essay detailing your interest in our MPS program). Two letters of recommendation. A writing sample. (A sample of your writing that demonstrates your ability to write clearly and logically. This can be a paper from a previous course, a professional report, or a similar document). Official transcripts from all colleges and universities attended.
Description: The Master of Professional Studies (MPS) is an online, 30-hour master's degree program for working professionals who wish to further develop their professional skills and knowledge base. This interdisciplinary degree is composed of three parts: a 9-hour professional studies core, a 15-hour primary concentration area, and a 6-hour cognate. The UNA Department of Geography & Environmental Sciences offers the Atmospheric Science concentration for this degree. Description:
The Doctor of Nursing Practice (DNP) degree is a practice-focused doctorate designed to prepare experts in specialized advanced nursing practice. The DNP curriculum at the University of North Alabama Anderson College of Nursing and Health Professions focuses on providing the skills and knowledge to enable graduates to provide the most advanced level of nursing care for individuals, families, and communities. Utilize advanced levels of clinical judgment, systems thinking, and accountability in designing, delivering, and evaluating evidence-based care to improve patient outcomes.
Critically appraise and synthesize evidence for the development of practice guidelines and projects.
Assume complex leadership roles to advance clinical practice and healthcare.

Employ information systems and technology in the delivery of healthcare.
Collaborate with interprofessional teams to analyze and improve health outcomes.

Faculty and students in the PhD in Environmental Science and Policy work to solve complex environmental problems at the local, regional, and global scales. The program has particular strengths in aquatic science, conservation biology, environmental health, geospatial science, and climate science.

Description: The PhD in Exercise Science and Health Promotion with a concentration in Exercise Physiology is a terminal degree that builds on the skills and competencies of the master's degree to prepare graduates for a wide variety of careers in academia, research, and clinical settings. The doctoral degree requires a minimum of 61 hours beyond the master's degree and culminates in the completion of a dissertation project. The core curriculum consists of 24 hours of coursework including advanced exercise physiology, research design, and statistics. The concentration consists of 12 hours of specialized exercise physiology-related coursework. The remaining coursework consists of 25 hours of dissertation research. Students in this program will work side-by-side with our well-accomplished faculty to develop a comprehensive research skill set. The program is designed to be completed in three to four years, though the student has up to six years to complete the degree requirements. The degree is offered as a residential program and requires a full-time commitment.

Students will use the newest technologies to design and implement exploration projects from start to finish, culminating in professional science communication. This unique program will bring in experts from a number of different exploration-related fields to guide students from their first class to their final project. The exploration science concentration offers a variety of courses and electives to suit student interests and needs, with opportunities for field experiences with real-world partners. Graduates of this program will be equipped for a broad spectrum of career paths, including but not limited to, private sector exploration (space, ocean, and terrestrial), national and international exploration agencies (such as NASA and NOAA), non-profit and educational exploration organizations, and government and military applications.

5. Submit a satisfactory score on the Alabama Educator Certification Assessment Program (AECAP) basic skills assessments.
6. Submit a writing sample that responds to a prompt provided by the program.
7. Complete a successful interview with program faculty.
8. Submit a clear background check.
Department: College of Education and Human Sciences
Description:
The School Counseling, P-12 program is designed to prepare master’s level school counselors to be leaders, advocates, and consultants in diverse P-12 school settings. The program is committed to a student-centered approach to learning which emphasizes developmental, preventative, and proactive services that are consistent with the American School Counselor Association (ASCA) National Model. Students develop a strong professional identity and foundational knowledge in eight core areas to deliver a comprehensive school counseling program focused on the academic, career, and social/emotional development of all students.

The program of study is consistent with the standards of the Council for Accreditation of Counseling and Related Educational Programs (CACREP) and the Alabama State Department of Education (ALSDE).

The program is CACREP accredited, and upon completion of the master's degree program, students are eligible to apply for P-12 certification in school counseling in Alabama and to sit for the National Counselor Examination (NCE) to become a National Certified Counselor (NCC).
Accredidation: The program is accredited by the Council for Accreditation of Counseling and Related Educational Programs (CACREP). The program of study is also consistent with the standards of the Alabama State Department of Education (ALSDE).

ProgramName: Master of Arts in Education (MAEd): Elementary Education K-6
EnglishScore: An official English proficiency score report is required for all applicants whose native language is not English. Test scores must be less than two years old at the time of application. The minimum score requirements are as follows: TOEFL (iBT) 79, IELTS 6.0, PTE 54, Duolingo 105, ELS Level 112 Certificate of Completion.
Requirements:
In addition to meeting the general admission requirements for graduate studies, the applicant must:

1. hold a valid bachelor’s level professional educator certificate in elementary education (K-6).
2. submit a copy of his/her valid teaching certificate.
3. submit three letters of recommendation with at least one from a current or former administrator.
4. submit a written essay describing why the applicant wants to pursue this master’s degree and his/her career goals.
5. submit a portfolio containing at least two artifacts from the applicant’s teaching career. At least one artifact must showcase the applicant’s skills in technology integration in the classroom. Each artifact must be accompanied by a brief explanation of the artifact.
6. submit a resume describing past work and educational experiences.
7. participate in a personal interview.
Department: College of Education and Human Sciences
Description: The Master of Arts in Education degree program in Elementary Education K-6 is designed to prepare highly qualified candidates to become exemplary elementary educators. The professional coursework is carefully designed to provide teacher candidates with knowledge of current research and effective instructional strategies. The curriculum and related field-based learning experiences provide candidates opportunities to develop the knowledge, skills, and dispositions necessary to teach children in diverse P-6 settings and to meet the challenges of contemporary elementary classrooms. Teacher candidates who successfully complete this program will be eligible to apply for the Alabama Class A Professional Educator Certificate in Elementary Education. The program is offered completely online.
Accredidation: All teacher certification programs are accredited by the Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP) and approved by the Alabama State Department of Education (ALSDE).

ProgramName: Master of Arts in Education (MAEd): Secondary Education
EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English must submit evidence of English proficiency by one of the following: TOEFL: minimum score of 79 (Internet-based), 550 (Paper-based); IELTS: minimum score of 6.0; Pearson Test of English (PTE) Academic: minimum score of 54; Duolingo: minimum score of 100; ELS Language Center: completion of Level 112.
Requirements: To be eligible for unconditional admission to the MAEd program, a student must have a bachelor's degree from a regionally accredited institution and meet the requirements for admission to the College of Graduate Studies. Additional admission requirements are as follows: Hold a valid Alabama Class B Professional Educator Certificate in the chosen teaching field OR meet the requirements for an Alabama Class B Professional Educator Certificate in the chosen teaching field. Submit a score on the general test of the Graduate Record Examination (GRE) that meets the minimum score requirement set by the Alabama State Department of Education (ALSDE). (Currently, a score of 290 combined on the verbal and quantitative sections is required for admission to a Class A program). NOTE: The GRE requirement is waived for applicants who have earned a master’s degree from a regionally accredited institution. Submit three letters of recommendation. Submit a writing sample that addresses the student’s reasons for pursuing the degree. Submit a copy of a valid teaching certificate. Submit official transcripts from all institutions attended. Submit a completed application to the College of Graduate Studies.
Department: College of Education and Human Sciences
Description: The M.A.Ed. in Secondary Education is designed for individuals who hold Class B certification and wish to obtain Class A certification in one of the following areas: Biology (6-12), Business Marketing Education (6-12), Chemistry (6-12), English Language Arts (6-12), General Science (6-12), History (6-12), Mathematics (6-12), Physics (6-12), or Social Science (6-12). Candidates may also add certification in English for Speakers of Other Languages (P-12).
Accredidation: The Teacher Education programs at the University of North Alabama are accredited by the Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP).

ProgramName: Master of Arts in Education (MAEd): P-12 Education (selected teaching fields)
EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English must provide evidence of English proficiency by one of the following: Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) iBT score of 79, International English Language Testing System (IELTS) academic score of 6.0, Pearson Test of English (PTE) academic score of 54, Duolingo score of 105, ELS Educational Services level 112 certificate of completion, Bachelor's or graduate degree from an accredited U.S. institution, or successful completion of the UNA English as a Second Language Program.
Requirements: Meet all university graduate admission requirements. Hold a bachelor's level professional educator certificate in the same teaching field(s) in which the Class A professional educator certificate is sought... Have a minimum GPA of 3.00 on all undergraduate coursework OR 3.25 on all graduate coursework... Provide a copy of their valid teaching certificate. Provide a Service Record form verifying a minimum of one full year of full-time satisfactory P-12 teaching experience... Applicants who do not meet requirement #5 may be admitted but must complete a 300-clock-hour internship... Provide three letters of recommendation... Provide a writing sample to be evaluated by program faculty... Provide a resume... A successful interview with program faculty may be required.
Description: The Master of Arts in Education (MAEd) program provides advanced study for individuals who hold, or are eligible to hold, a Class B professional educator certificate in a teaching field and wish to pursue a master’s degree in that field, leading to a Class A professional educator certificate. The program is designed to extend the candidate’s knowledge of subject matter, to improve teaching skills and professional competency, and to provide opportunity to analyze and evaluate concepts and practices related to the chosen teaching field. The College of Education and Human Sciences is accredited by the Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP).
Accredidation: The College of Education and Human Sciences is accredited by the Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP).

ProgramName: Master of Arts in Education (MAEd): Instructional Leadership
Requirements: An official transcript from the institution that awarded the baccalaureate degree. A valid teaching certificate. Three years of P-12 professional educational work experience. Two letters of recommendation, including one from the applicant's current principal or supervisor. A completed Instructional Leadership Supplemental Application. A qualifying score on either the Miller Analogies Test (MAT) or the Graduate Record Examination (GRE) (Verbal plus Quantitative). A completed 'Verification of Educational Experience' form. A completed 'Principal Recommendation' form. An essay (see department for prompt). A successful interview with the Instructional Leadership Admissions Committee.
Department: College of Education and Human Sciences
Description: The Master of Arts in Education: Instructional Leadership is designed to prepare experienced educators for P-12 school leadership positions. School leaders are vital to creating schools in which all students are able to learn, and they are responsible for setting the vision of a school; cultivating a positive, safe, and instructionally powerful learning environment; and developing the professional capacity of teachers and staff. The program is designed for teachers who are ready for new opportunities and to take on leadership roles as a principal, assistant principal, or other school or school system leader. Upon completion of this program, students are eligible for a Class A Professional Educator Certificate in Instructional Leadership.

ProgramName: Master of Arts in Education (MAEd): Special Education: Collaborative Teacher K-6 and/or 6-12
EnglishScore: All international students are required to demonstrate English proficiency prior to admission. Options to demonstrate proficiency include minimum scores on the TOEFL (79 iBT or 550 PBT), IELTS (6.0), PTE (54), Duolingo English Test (105), or completion of ELS Language Center Level 112.
Requirements: To be considered for admission to the MAEd Special Education: Collaborative Teacher K-6 or 6-12 program, applicants must meet the following requirements: A completed application for admission to Graduate Studies. Official transcripts from all institutions attended. An overall undergraduate GPA of at least 2.75, or a GPA of at least 3.00 on the last 30 semester hours of undergraduate work. A valid bachelor’s level professional educator certificate in any teaching field (from Alabama or another state). Two years of full-time, satisfactory P-12 teaching experience. A writing sample that demonstrates the applicant’s writing ability. The writing sample will be evaluated based on the following: content/organization, grammar/mechanics, and style/format. A successful interview with the program faculty. Submission of the 'Verification of Educational Experience' form.
Department: College of Education and Human Sciences
Concentration: Special Education: Collaborative Teacher K-6 and/or 6-12
Description: The special education program provides the student who already holds teacher certification in another area with the opportunity to become certified in special education. The program leads to a Master of Arts in Education degree and Class A certification in collaborative special education teacher (K-6 and/or 6-12). Candidates choose a concentration in grades K-6, grades 6-12, or both.
Accredidation: The College of Education and Human Sciences is accredited by the Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP).

ProgramName: Master of Arts in Education (MAEd) in Secondary Education-English/Language Arts
EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English are required to demonstrate English proficiency by submitting an official test score report from Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL), International English Language Testing System (IELTS), Pearson Test of English (PTE), or Duolingo.
Requirements: Applicants must meet the general requirements for graduate admission which include completing the application for admission, paying the nonrefundable application fee, and submitting official transcripts from all colleges and universities attended. The University of North Alabama has temporarily waived the graduate entrance exam requirement (GRE/GMAT/MAT) for all graduate programs through Fall 2025. For the Class A certification track, an applicant must hold a bachelor’s level professional educator certificate in the same teaching field. For the non-certification track, an applicant must hold a bachelor’s degree from a regionally accredited institution.
Department: College of Education and Human Sciences
Description: The Master of Arts in Education (MAEd) in Secondary Education is designed for candidates who hold a bachelor’s level professional educator certificate in a secondary teaching field and wish to complete a master’s degree and an advanced level professional educator certificate in that same teaching field. Teaching fields are available in biology, business-marketing education, chemistry, English/language arts, general science, geography, history, mathematics, and social science. The program is offered completely online.

ProgramName: Master of Arts in Education (MAEd) in Secondary Education – English/Language Arts – Alternative Plan
EnglishScore: An applicant whose native language is not English must submit an official score report from the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL), the International English Language Testing System (IELTS), Pearson Test of English Academic (PTE-A) or Duolingo English Test. Minimum score requirements: TOEFL IBT - 79; TOEFL PBT - 550; IELTS - 6.0; PTE-A - 54; or Duolingo English Test - 105. Students may also meet the English proficiency requirement by completing the ELS Language Center’s intensive program level 112.
Requirements:
Submit a completed Application for Admission to the Office of Graduate Admissions.
Submit official transcripts from all colleges/universities attended to the Office of Graduate Admissions.
Possess an undergraduate degree with a minimum grade point average (GPA) of 2.75 from a regionally accredited institution, or a GPA of 3.0 on the last 30 semester hours.
Submission of an official score report of one of the following:
Praxis II subject area assessment with a passing score
Miller Analogies Test (MAT) with a score of 388 or higher
Graduate Record Examination (GRE) with a score of 294 (Verbal + Quantitative) or higher.
A 24-30 semester hour major in the teaching field with a GPA of 2.75 or above. (Must be approved by the Department of Secondary Education.) All courses in the major must be completed with a grade of C or better. Courses must meet Alabama State Board of Education course distribution requirements.
Submission of an acceptable writing sample as specified by the department.
Three letters of recommendation.
Submission of a resume.
Submission of a narrative describing the applicant’s commitment to the profession of teaching, expectations of the program, and any personal experiences relevant to teaching.
Submission of a completed Disposition Form.
Submission of a verified background clearance.
Department: College of Education and Human Sciences
Description: The Master of Arts in Education degree program with a major in secondary education is a non-traditional program that is designed to provide qualified individuals who hold a bachelor’s degree in a specific teaching field with the knowledge, skills, and dispositions to become certified teachers in the State of Alabama in a specific 6-12 teaching field. The program in Secondary Education is offered with an emphasis in English/language arts, general science, history, or mathematics. Students successfully completing the program will meet all requirements for a Master’s level teacher certification.
Accredidation: The teacher education programs are accredited by the Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP) and the Alabama State Department of Education (ALSDE).

ProgramName: Master of Science in Exercise Science and Health Promotion: Exercise Science
EnglishScore: International students must demonstrate English proficiency. UNA will accept any of the following to satisfy this requirement: Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) with a minimum score of 550 on the paper-based test or 79 on the internet-based test. International English Language Testing System (IELTS) with a minimum score of 6.0. Pearson Test of English (PTE) Academic with a minimum score of 54. Duolingo with a minimum score of 110. Successful completion of the ELS Language Center's level 112.
Requirements:
Unconditional Admission to the Master of Science in Exercise Science and Health Promotion program requires the following:
1. An earned bachelor’s degree from a regionally accredited institution with a minimum 2.75 grade point average (4.0 scale) in the last 60 hours of undergraduate coursework, or a minimum 2.5 grade point average overall.
2. Official transcripts from all post-secondary institutions attended must be provided.
3. Successful completion of the following undergraduate courses with a C or better:
    * Human Anatomy and Physiology I with lab
    * Human Anatomy and Physiology II with lab
    * Exercise Physiology with lab
    * Kinesiology/Biomechanics
4. Submission of a 500-word essay detailing professional goals and reasons for pursuing a graduate degree at UNA.
5. Submission of a resume of professional and educational experiences.
Department: Anderson College of Nursing and Health Professions
Description: The Master of Science in Exercise Science and Health Promotion (ESHP) prepares students to be leaders and practitioners with an advanced body of knowledge in exercise science and health promotion. Students can choose to pursue a concentration in either Exercise Science or Health Promotion. The concentration in Exercise Science is intended for those individuals with an undergraduate degree in Exercise Science, Kinesiology, Human Performance, or a related field. It requires 30 credit hours and is delivered online. This concentration is designed for those students who want to enhance their education in preparation for a doctoral program or to become a practitioner who designs and implements exercise programs for a variety of populations.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Exercise Science and Health Promotion: Kinesiology
EnglishScore: For international graduate admission, proof of English proficiency is required. Accepted tests and minimum scores are: TOEFL iBT 79 or PBT 550, IELTS 6.0, PTE 54, Duolingo 100, or ELS Level 112.
Requirements: Admission to the Office of Graduate Studies. For unconditional admission, a minimum overall undergraduate GPA of 2.75 on a 4.0 scale. For conditional admission, an overall undergraduate GPA of 2.50 to 2.74 on a 4.0 scale. No additional application materials are required.
Department: College of Education and Human Sciences

ProgramName: Master of Science in Exercise Science and Health Promotion: Wellness and Health Promotion
EnglishScore: English proficiency must be demonstrated by any one of the following: Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) iBT minimum score of 79. International English Language Testing System (IELTS) minimum score of 6.0. Pearson Test of English (PTE) Academic minimum score of 54. Duolingo English Test minimum score of 100. ELS Language Centers - completion of Level 112. TOEFL PBT minimum score of 550.
Requirements:
To be considered for admission to the Master of Science in Exercise Science & Health Promotion, applicants must meet the general requirements for admission to the Office of Graduate Studies. Applicants must also submit the following directly to the Office of Graduate Studies:

*   Completed application for graduate studies
*   Official transcripts from all institutions attended
*   Three letters of recommendation
*   A two-page essay explaining your background in exercise science, personal philosophy of wellness and professional career goals
*   Official GRE scores (verbal and quantitative) taken within the last five years are required if undergraduate GPA is below 3.0
*   Additional documents may be requested
Department: College of Education and Human Sciences
Description: The Master of Science degree in Exercise Science and Health Promotion is designed to train students for careers in fields of corporate and community wellness and health promotion, university health and wellness, cardiac rehabilitation, clinical exercise physiology, strength and conditioning, sports performance and human performance. The degree provides the coursework and many practical experiences for students to be successful in these fields. The mission of the Master of Science degree in Exercise Science and Health Promotion program is to prepare qualified professionals who demonstrate discipline specific knowledge, possess the necessary skills to be competent, and exhibit professional disposition in a variety of settings. The program will enable students to think critically and analytically about the role of physical activity, exercise, and lifestyle behaviors on human performance and health.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Mathematics (MS) Degree
EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English must submit proof of English proficiency. This can be done by submitting one of the following: Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) score of 79 iBT (550 paper-based), International English Language Testing System (IELTS) score of 6.0, Pearson Test of English (PTE) score of 54, Duolingo English Test score of 100, or graduation from ELS level 112.
Requirements: Admission to the M.S. in mathematics program requires an undergraduate degree from an accredited institution with an undergraduate major in mathematics or a major with a substantial number of mathematics courses. An applicant with a bachelor's degree in a field other than mathematics may also be admitted upon completion, with satisfactory grades, of the mathematics courses prerequisite for the master’s program. Admission to the program also requires a minimum overall undergraduate GPA of 2.50. An applicant with a GPA between 2.0 and 2.49 may be admitted conditionally. Application is made to the Office of Graduate Admissions.
Department: College of Arts, Sciences, and Engineering
Description: The Master of Science in Mathematics at the University of North Alabama is a 30-credit-hour, fully-online program. Students may earn their degree in as little as one year (three semesters), or may opt for a slower-paced plan of study. The curriculum provides students with a strong background in mathematics in a variety of different areas. Additionally, students can pursue an optional concentration in Data Science by choosing four courses from a list of approved courses. The M.S. in Mathematics is a flexible degree. Students may choose the thesis option or the non-thesis option. Those who wish to continue their education with a Ph.D. in Mathematics at another institution are advised to choose the thesis option. Those who wish to teach at the community college level, at the high school level (including dual-enrollment classes), or work in business, industry, or government may choose either option, but may prefer the non-thesis option.
MinimumGreScore: A score of at least 290 on the verbal and quantitative portions of the Graduate Record Examination (GRE), with at least 140 on the verbal portion and at least 140 on the quantitative portion.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Nursing (MSN): Nursing in Teaching-Learning Environment
EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English must submit an official score report from one of the following English proficiency examinations: TOEFL, IELTS, PTE, or Duolingo. The scores must be less than two years old.
Requirements: Application to the Office of Graduate Admissions. Official transcripts from each institution attended. A Bachelor of Science in Nursing (BSN) degree from a regionally accredited institution and a nursing program accredited by the Accreditation Commission for Education in Nursing (ACEN), or the Commission on Collegiate Nursing Education (CCNE). An overall undergraduate GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale. Current unencumbered licensure as a registered nurse (RN) in the United States. A minimum of one-year full-time nursing experience as a registered nurse prior to clinical courses. Three letters of recommendation from persons who can attest to the applicant’s academic and/or professional abilities. A curriculum vitae or resume. A Statement of Purpose that addresses how the MSN degree will help the applicant meet professional and personal goals.
Department: Anderson College of Nursing and Health Professions
Description: The Anderson College of Nursing and Health Professions offers a Master of Science in Nursing degree with two track options: Nursing in Teaching-Learning Environments and Nursing Leadership in Organizational Environments. Both tracks are offered totally online. The program is designed for completion in two years (five semesters), but may be taken part-time over a longer period. The MSN Program is designed for nurses holding a bachelor's degree in nursing who desire an advanced degree. This option prepares graduates to apply principles of teaching-learning in a variety of settings including academic and staff development. Students participate in a variety of supervised teaching experiences at the undergraduate level in the classroom and clinical settings. Graduates of the teaching track will meet the educational requirements for the National League for Nursing's Certified Nurse Educator (CNE) examination.
Accredidation: The baccalaureate degree program in nursing, master's degree program in nursing, and post-graduate APRN certificate program at the University of North Alabama are accredited by the Commission on Collegiate Nursing Education (http://www.ccneaccreditation.org).

ProgramName: Master of Science in Nursing (MSN): Nursing Leadership in Organizational Environments
EnglishScore: Proof of English proficiency is required of all applicants whose native language is not English, regardless of country of citizenship. UNA accepts the following as proof of English proficiency: Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) iBT - Minimum Score 79, International English Language Testing System (IELTS) - Minimum Score 6.0, Pearson Test of English (PTE) - Minimum Score 54, Duolingo English Test - Minimum Score 110, ELS Language Centers - Level 112.
Requirements: Complete application to Graduate Admissions. Official transcripts from all institutions of higher learning with an overall GPA of 3.0 or greater on a 4.0 scale. Hold an unencumbered license as a registered nurse in the United States. Two professional recommendations addressing professional competence. One recommendation from the immediate supervisor is preferred. Successful completion of an undergraduate statistics course with a grade of C or better. Successful completion of an undergraduate nursing research course with a grade of C or better. Personal statement/essay of 500 words or less addressing a time the applicant influenced change in practice. Resume detailing nursing experience.
Department: Anderson College of Nursing and Health Professions
Description:
The Anderson College of Nursing and Health Professions offers the following options for graduate study in nursing: a Master of Science in Nursing (MSN) for the registered nurse who has completed a Bachelor of Science in Nursing (BSN); a Master of Science in Nursing (MSN) for the registered nurse who has completed an Associate of Science in Nursing (ASN); an RN to BSN/MSN program for the registered nurse who has completed an Associate of Science in Nursing (ASN); and three post-graduate certificate programs in nursing.

The MSN curriculum is designed to prepare professional nurses for advanced nursing roles in a variety of settings. The curriculum is based on the Essentials of Master’s Education in Nursing (2011) and the specific professional standards of practice for each specialty. Graduates from the Master of Science in Nursing program are prepared for leadership roles in nursing education, leadership in organizational environments, and family nurse practitioner.
Accredidation: The master’s degree program in nursing at the University of North Alabama is accredited by the Commission on Collegiate Nursing Education (http://www.ccneaccreditation.org).

ProgramName: Master of Science in Nursing (MSN): Family Nurse Practitioner
EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English are required to demonstrate English proficiency. Minimum scores are: TOEFL 79 (iBT) or 550 (PBT), IELTS 6.0, PTE 54, Duolingo 100, or successful completion of ELS Language Center’s Level 112.
Requirements:
1. Meet all admission requirements of the Office of Graduate Studies.
2. BSN from a nationally accredited nursing program (ACEN or CCNE).
3. A minimum overall undergraduate GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale or a GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale on the last 60 semester hours of undergraduate work. A holistic review will be considered on an individual basis for all applicants meeting minimum Graduate Studies admission requirements.
4. Current unencumbered RN licensure in the state where clinicals will be completed.
5. Evidence of completion of an undergraduate or graduate statistics course with a grade of C or better.
6. Submission of three letters of professional reference attesting to the applicant's potential for graduate study. It is recommended that at least one reference be from a faculty who can attest to academic ability and one from a supervisor who can attest to clinical practice. Professional references from colleagues are acceptable. References from relatives are not acceptable.
7. Submission of a curriculum vitae/resume'.
8. A personal statement describing professional goals.
9. A personal interview may be required.
Department: Anderson College of Nursing and Health Professions
Description: The Family Nurse Practitioner concentration prepares the graduate to provide primary care for persons of all ages in a variety of settings. The program builds on the baccalaureate nursing foundation and develops the assessment, diagnosis and management skills needed to provide quality primary health care for individuals and families. The graduate will be eligible to sit for national certification examinations as a family nurse practitioner. The program is offered in an on-line format with required clinical hours.
Accredidation: The master's degree program in nursing at the University of North Alabama is accredited by the Commission on Collegiate Nursing Education (http://www.ccneaccreditation.org).

ProgramName: Master of Science (MS) Degree in Sport and Recreation Management: Sport Management
EnglishScore: For applicants whose native language is not English, evidence of English proficiency is required. Accepted tests and minimum scores include: IELTS (6.0), TOEFL iBT (79), paper-based TOEFL (550), PTE Academic (54), or Duolingo English Test (100). Completion of Level 112 at an ELS Language Center is also accepted.
Requirements: Admission to the Master of Science in Sport and Recreation Management requires: 1. a completed application for admission to graduate study; 2. an official transcript from the college or university that awarded the baccalaureate degree; 3. official transcripts from all other colleges and universities attended; 4. a score on the Graduate Record Examination (GRE) general test (verbal and quantitative) or the Miller Analogies Test (MAT) that meets one of the following criteria: a. An undergraduate GPA of 2.75 or above on a 4.00 scale and a GRE score of at least 286 (verbal + quantitative) or a MAT score of at least 370. b. An undergraduate GPA of 3.00 or above on a 4.00 scale and a GRE score of at least 283 (verbal + quantitative) or a MAT score of at least 360. c. An undergraduate GPA between 2.50 and 2.74 and a GRE score of 290 or a MAT score of 380. d. A completed graduate degree from a regionally accredited institution with at least a 3.00 GPA. 5. three letters of recommendation; and 6. approval from the department. (Meeting the minimum requirements does not guarantee admission.)
Department: College of Education and Human Sciences
Description: The master of science degree in Sport and Recreation Management is a 30-36 hour graduate program designed to prepare students for leadership positions in the dynamic sport and recreation industry. Students select one of two concentrations: Sport Management or Recreation Management. This graduate program is offered entirely online and does not require a thesis. Students may enroll on a full-time or part-time basis. Students may select from a non-thesis or a thesis option for this program.

ProgramName: Master of Science (MS) Degree in Sport and Recreation Management: Recreation Management
EnglishScore: International applicants must provide evidence of English proficiency by providing an official score report from one of the following: TOEFL (Minimum score of 79 iBT or 550 PBT), IELTS (Minimum score of 6.0), PTE (Minimum score of 54), Duolingo (Minimum score of 100), or ELS (Successful completion of ELS Language Center's level 112).
Requirements:
To be considered for unconditional admission to the Sport and Recreation Management program, the applicant must have an undergraduate degree from an accredited institution and meet the requirement for admission to the College of Graduate Studies. The undergraduate degree can be in any discipline. Applicants must have a minimum undergraduate grade point average (GPA) of 2.75 overall OR 3.0 on the last 30 semester hours.

Applicants who do not meet the unconditional GPA requirement may be eligible for conditional admission with an undergraduate GPA between 2.50 and 2.74 and submission of a 500-word statement of purpose. Students admitted conditionally must maintain a minimum 3.0 GPA in the first nine (9) hours of graduate coursework at UNA to remain in the program.
Department: Anderson College of Nursing and Health Professions
Description: The Sport and Recreation Management graduate program is a 30-hour program with a concentration in either Sport Management or Recreation Management. This program is designed to provide students with the training and education for a career in the sport industry or recreation field. Students will take core classes that develop a foundation in research, law and ethics, technology, programming, administration, and finance. The program is offered completely online.
Accredidation: The Sport and Recreation Management programs are accredited by the Council on Accreditation of Parks, Recreation, Tourism, and Related Professions (COAPRT). COAPRT accredits baccalaureate programs in recreation, park resources, and leisure services. The UNA Sport and Recreation Management program is one of two programs in the state of Alabama to hold COAPRT accreditation.

ProgramName: Philosophy MA
EnglishScore: Students from non-English speaking countries must submit an official English proficiency score. Minimum scores are TOEFL-iBT 79, IELTS 6.0, PTE 54, Duolingo 105, or successful completion of ELS Level 112.
Requirements: Admission to the Master of Arts in Philosophy program requires the applicant to hold a baccalaureate degree from an accredited institution. Admission also requires submission of the following: Completed application to the Office of Graduate Admissions, A 300-400 word statement of purpose outlining the applicant's interest in the program, A 7-10 page writing sample that displays the applicant's philosophical writing abilities, Two letters of recommendation from former professors that testify to the applicant's academic abilities, Official transcripts from all institutions attended.

ProgramName: Philosophy PhD
Physical Therapy DPT
Requirements: Applicants must hold a baccalaureate degree from a regionally accredited institution, completed prior to the start of the DPT program. A minimum GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale is required for both cumulative GPA and prerequisite course GPA. All prerequisite coursework must be completed with a C or better prior to the start of the DPT program, and science prerequisites must have been completed within 10 years of application. Official transcripts from all institutions attended must be sent to PTCAS. Three letters of recommendation are required and must be submitted through PTCAS; one must be from a licensed physical therapist. A minimum of 40 observation hours under the supervision of a licensed physical therapist are required from at least two different settings. The PTCAS application includes an essay that will be reviewed. GRE Scores are NOT required for admission. Qualified applicants will be invited for a required virtual interview.
Description: The mission of the University of North Alabama Doctor of Physical Therapy Program is to educate and prepare compassionate and ethical entry-level physical therapists who are dedicated to life-long learning and evidence-based practice. Graduates will be prepared to provide patient-centered care to a diverse population to optimize function and improve the quality of life of individuals and society. The Doctor of Physical Therapy program is a full-time, three-year program consisting of nine consecutive semesters of coursework including 32 weeks of full-time clinical education experiences.
Accredidation: The Doctor of Physical Therapy Program at the University of North Alabama is accredited by the Commission on Accreditation in Physical Therapy Education (CAPTE), 3030 Potomac Ave., Suite 100, Alexandria, Virginia 22305-3085; telephone: 703-706-3245; email: accreditation@apta.org; website: http://www.capteonline.org. Students graduating with a B.S. in Chemistry are well prepared for a wide range of career opportunities including chemistry, environmental science, chemical sales, chemical information science, technical writing, and laboratory support.
